item.title: Caeal | Requested exemption from schools during electoral act
item.description: The Commission on Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) has organized a session with various educational institutions to remember the need for schools to respect the “principles of justice, impartiality and integrity in the elections”. The initiative was invited by the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). With several schools linked to government -funded associations that present candidate lists for elections, cases of election campaign through students, as with the delivery of leaflets, are not uncommon. For this reason, Caeal highlighted the need for the directions to ensure that schools remain on the sidelines of the electoral act. The chairman of the committee, Judge Seng Ioi Man, stressed in the session that "public schools must maintain a neutral position, and that their employees should also maintain a neutral position before the various application lists, during the execution of their tasks, not being able to proceed electoral advertising during the time or working space." Regarding private schools, the official argued that “electoral law does not specifically regulate private schools in the field of electoral propaganda”, but that internal guidelines “must be decided and applied by the private schools themselves, but always in accordance with the law and carried out within the period of electoral propaganda”.

item.title: Commerce | Suppliers ask for autonomy to American products
item.description: To avoid the impact of US tariffs, the Macao suppliers' union association advocates greater gradual autonomy from imported products in America. The idea came from the association's president, IP Sio Man, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. According to IP, US dependence is negative because tariff policies are unpredictable and are constantly changing. The official indicated that last year, the value of products Macau exported to the US was 300 million patacas, while the value of imported products from the US was 70 billion patacas. On the other hand, IP Sio Man anticipated that the Macao government is unable to follow the interior in adopting retaliation policies against the US, so it should follow an alternative path. But even though Macau follows the background policy, IP has devalued the case, considering that it will not have great impact, because in recent years, Macau has actively explored new markets and can import products from other regions to replace those of the US.

item.title: Fires | Minus 15 percent occurrences
item.description:
In the first three months of the year there was a general decrease in the occurrences that implied the intervention of the Fire Department. Still, the authorities were called to intervene in 13,207 cases
In the first three months of the year the number of fires recorded by the Fire Department (CB) presented a 15.35 percent reduction with 215 occurrences compared to the same period. The first quarter figures of the year were presented yesterday at a press conference. According to official data, between January and March this year there were fewer fires compared to the same period, when the number of fires had been 254 occurrences. Among the 215 fires, 155 were extinguished without resorting to the use of hoses. Last year, the number of fire extinguished without the need to turn on the hoses had been 204. Regarding the fires of the first months of this year, 35 fireworks were due to situations of burnt food. Last year, this type of occurrences had contributed to 61 cases. Among the other causes of fire occurrences are the oblivion of linked stoves, flames that are not fully extinguished, burning incense, candles and votive papers, short circuits in electrical installations and mechanical failures. Despite the reduction of fires, in the first half were several occurrences in residential buildings that caused at least five injured. The numbers show that the general general of occurrences in which the Fire Department had to intervene presented a 6.32 percent reduction from 14,098 cases to 13,207 cases. Less ambulances Regarding data on ambulance exits there was a reduction in cases of 3.1 percent to 11,406 occurrences, which required the use of 12,221 vehicles, a reduction of 3.43 percent. In the same period, 11,774 occurrences were registered that required the departure of 12,655 emergency vehicles. About this difference, the Fire Department indicated that it was due to "mainly reducing cases of mild fever indisposition and breathing difficulties." "The general cases of relief dealt essentially with dizziness, abdominal pain, breathing difficulties, vomiting, fevers and various types of injuries," he was added. Also in rescue operations there was a reduction of 3.3 percent, from 454 cases to 439 cases. Finally, with regard to special services, a reduction of 29.01 percent, from 1,616 cases to 1,144 cases, a difference of 29.21 percent was found.

item.title: AMCM | Securities Deposit and Settlement Center loses 7.18 million
item.description:
A Central de Depósito e Liquidação de Valores Mobiliários de Macau, controlada a 100 por cento pela RAEM, continua a registar prejuízos sucessivos. Desde 2022, a empresa criada para diversificar a economia de Macau nunca apresentou lucros
Macao's central deposit and settlement company (MCSD) registered losses of 7.18 million patacas last year. This is the second consecutive year with loss of the company controlled 100 percent by the Monetary Authority of Macau (AMCM), which had presented losses of 6.7 million patacas in the previous year. Created in 2021, MCSD emerged within the policy of the Ho IAT SENG government to diversify the economy in the field of finance and has as its functions the exploitation of financial infrastructure, central registration services, compensation, settlement and deposit of securities. Within these functions, MCSD has been supporting the obligation to be borrowed. However, the company's numbers insist on continuing to have damage. In the first full year of operations in 2022, the company that has a corporate capital of 50 million Patacas, had losses of 3.9 million patacas. The following year, the damage rose to 6.7 million patacas and the latest data show a new negative record of 7.18 million patacas. More revenues and expenses Despite the negative scenario, revenues originated by contracts with participants in the financial market of Macau even registered an increase. Currently, on the MCSD portal, about 90 entities appear as “participants”. In 2024, revenues derived from participation contracts rose to 2.9 million patacas, when the previous year had been about 966,000 patacas. In terms of the remaining revenues of last year, a 1 million patacas was calculated in interest, with the other services generated 11,300 patacas and the shift gains generating 721 patacas. In terms of expenses there was also an increase to 11.2 million patacas by 2024, compared to 9.2 million patacas of 2023. The highest cost was for the remuneration of workers from 3.1 million patacas to 4.6 million patacas. For this increase contributed the recruitment of five employees, totaling 13 workers at the end of 2024. The other major expense was due to pay the telecommunications post services that was 3.2 million patacas, below the cost of 3.3 million from the previous year.

item.title: Consumption | Confidence index with ambiguous results
item.description:
The consumer confidence rate rose slightly during the third quarter, still remaining close to negative terrain. An inquiry, prepared by Must, demonstrates the increase in confidence in home purchase and financial investments, but a breakdown of confidence in the local economy, employment, prices and evolution of living level
The University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must, Siga Inglesa) published on Monday the latest consumer confidence rate for the first three months of this year, revealing a slight climb of the population's belief in the economic panorama of Macao. The inquiry carried out by the Must Institute for Sustainable Development is based on the analysis of six categories: “price level”, “housing purchase”, “lifestyle”, “employment”, “investments” and “local economy”. Of the six categories, two registered climbs and four descents. According to a statement issued by the team that made the inquiry, the general index increased by 0.85 percent compared to the previous quarter, in a scale between 0 and 200, in 103.82 points, reaching the fourth quarter followed by rise in the overall index. Given the general results, academics consider that the general confidence of Macao consumers is in a phase of stability. It should be noted that in the last three months of 2024, the general index rose 2.54 percent compared to the previous quarter. Point by point Among the six areas analyzed, two recorded reliable climbs in the first quarter of 2025. Trust in the shareholder market and financial investments rose 16.7 percent to 112.37 points, registering the highest fluctuation. Also the confidence in the purchase of housing rose 2.4 percent, entering a positive land (100.22 points), after increasing 6.5 percent in the last three months of last year, following the descent of housing prices. In the negative field, the largest descent happened in the chapter of trust in the local economy, which fell 3.14 percent to the border of lack of confidence, with 100.61 points, almost repeating the drop in the last three months of 2024 (3.13 percent) and adding the third consecutive quarter in breaking. Also the confidence in relation prices fell 2.32 percent for negative terrain (98 points), after the last quarter of 2024 has risen 6.38 percent for neutrality (100.35). Confidence in living level began to occupy the second place in the podium, despite the quarterly descent from 0.2 percent to 108.3 points. Also confidence in the labor market descended 0.76 percent to 103.39 points. Must's team highlighted the fact that confidence in the local economy has been falling three in a row, which considers it to be a sign of alert to risk in the economic environment. Academics also highlight the weak growth of the global economy as an influence on the results of the inquiry, which was performed before the imposition of the global scale of commercial tariffs by Donald Trump administration.

item.title: Housing | Request support for those in the waiting list
item.description:
In the middle of the electoral pre-campaign, Nick Lei has insisted on the subject of housing. The deputy released yesterday a written interpellation where he asks for the return of the allowance for those who wait for a social housing fraction, and the reduction of waiting time for the delivery of a home
For more than three months from the beginning of the campaign for the next elections that will select the future cast of the Legislative Assembly, Nick Lei seems to have chosen one of his priorities: public housing. After on Monday, the deputy linked to the Fujian community released a response from the Housing Institute to a written interpellation on economic housing, yesterday was the turn to address social housing. Nick Law insists on the return of the subsidy to help pay the income to candidates waiting for a fraction. The so -called “residence allowance” was created in Edmund Ho's second term in government leadership, to help families who met the criteria for access to a social housing, but who were on the waiting list because there is no available apartments. In the last round of the support, in 2022, the amount of the subsidy was 1,650 patacas per month, for aggregates with one or two members, and 2,500 patacas per month, for household aggregates with more than two people. The deputy acknowledges that in the near future, the supply of social housing may satisfy the demand. But for now, there are those who have been waiting for a fraction for over two and a half years. "It should be noted that families who expect social housing are all composed of economically disadvantaged residents. Although the government has ensured that the waiting for a fraction was reduced to a year after the implementation of the permanent candidacy mechanism, this continues not to reflect real wait between the various types of apartment typology," said the deputy.
More worthwhile Nick Law sets the example of the social housing apartment candidates, which largely exceed the offer. But it admits that the blocks of this type of public housing in zone A of new landfills, which must be completed between 2026 and 2027, can help solve the situation by offering about 4,088 apartments, of which 3,276 are T1. In addition, also the Avenida Venceslau de Morais Social Housing Complex, the Mong Son Building will help to bridge the gaps on the side of the offer. This building consists of three blocks, with 24 to 35 floors, three floors in a basement, providing 885 T1 typology fractions and 705 T2 typology fractions, totaling 1,590 social housing fractions. The deputy argues that the financial pressure caused by the lease market seriously affects the poorest families, especially compared to the annual rise of 3.9 percent of the income averages last year. Another of the deputy's demands is the maximum guarantee that the government gave four years, between the moment a social housing candidacy is accepted and the delivery of a home. Nick Law would like this warranty period to be reduced.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Checks, economy and great bay should be sam hu fai bets
item.description:
The government lines for this year are presented on Monday, marking the debut of Sam Hou Fai in one of the most anticipated moments of the local political calendar. Game recipes and economic predictions should be on the table, according to José Sales Marques and Lou Shenghua. The future of pecuniary checks may be another matter to be in attention
Sam Hou Fai has been in the government for almost five months and is preparing to present, next Monday, his first report of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year. Great expectations often reside in the amounts of pecuniary checks, the values ​​attributed to social support and other budgetary predictions, especially after the territory has been through a hard economic period with Covid-19. LAG 2025 should focus on these themes, and Macao's integration into the various regional cooperation projects, such as Hengqin Island or the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Fulfilling the annual tradition of local politics, Sam Hou Fai made the usual round of auscultations to local associations, in order to know his opinions on the main measures to take. Listened to by HM, economist José Sales Marques expects clarity in the policies announced at the economic level. "I would like to see these LAG bring greater clarity on economic policies and the vision for the future of MSAR. I speak of structural measures that encourage the trust of the private investor, and that also realize such reforms of public administration to increase efficiency and effectiveness," he said. Sales Marques also said that "I would like to clearly see Macao's positions and priorities in his relationship with countries and regions of the world, including measures that lead to deepen the role of Sino-Midfone and Multicultural Dialogue Platform." Lou Shenghua, a political analyst and professor at Macao Polytechnic University (UPM), said the main ideas presented will be in accordance with what Sam Hou Fai presented in the electoral program. "The tonic can be placed in improving the effectiveness of governance, moderate economic diversification, the construction of the Hengqin cooperation zone and the issues related to the subsistence means of people," said the analyst, stressing that "citizens may be more concerned with subsistence -related issues." And what program presented Sam Hou Fai in September last year, when it was glimpsed that he would be the only candidate for the position of Chief Executive? A program that has as its “maximum objective to meet citizens' expectations for a better life” and the “fundamental orientation of implementing the principle of a country, two systems” in a full, correct and firm way ”. The importance of national security was not forgotten, referring to the need for defense “of sovereignty, security and interests of the country's development”. About the sin, Sam Hou Fai said he wanted to erect a "macao based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." The then only candidate to head the government promised to improve the government's governing capacity. "We will strive to raise the capacity and level of governance of MSAR, the change in the concepts of governance, the optimization of the form of governance, the persistence of macao governance in accordance with the law, and the deepening of the reform of public administration and the legal system." Thus, he said "optimizing forms of governance, giving greater importance to the role of advisory bodies, experts and academics, and love associations of the country and Macao, widely listening to the opinions and suggestions of various sectors, different industry branches and various social strata." It remains to be seen if the lag will bring these tin aspects to the field of actions and concrete measures. MATE On Monday, the agenda continues as usual in the presentation of a report of the lag. First Sam Hou Fai will go to the Legislative Assembly, from 15h, make a general presentation to the deputies of political and budgetary issues essential for this year, followed by a press conference. The next day, it is a day of debate in the hemicycle on the same report, then followed the sectoral debates with all secretaries until the 30th of this month. One of the political themes that have been in the DAY ORDER is the value of pecuniary checks and whether or not they are attributed to residents living outside Macao. There are analysts to defend the reformulation of the program, but Sales Marques recalls that "the amount expected for pecuniary checks in the budget discussion for 2025 is 10,000 patacas for permanent residents." “Predicted budget revenues were based on calculation a gross revenue forecast of 240 billion patacas to an average of 20 billion per month. It turns out that the effective revenues obtained until the end of the first quarter of this year were short, with a deviation of less than four billion. be hit. ” Given these less optimistic predictions, referred to by the Secretary himself for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP last week, Sales Marques believes that, if there are adjustments in the checks, will be "small". "As for the distribution method, I predict that it remains the same," he said. Lou Shenghua believes that "the pecuniary reimbursement plan may change." "In terms of amount, it is likely to maintain the value of ten thousand patacas per resident, but regarding the form, it can be attributed to consumer valleys," he said. Last day 1, Secretary Tai Kin IP said the budget accounts are still short of expected. "We noticed that in the first three months of 2025 the gross revenues of the games reached 57.66 billion patacas, remaining the value almost unchanged in annual terms, not yet reaching the expected monthly average of 20 billion patacas." Thus, it was left the warning that "this year's financial revenues may not be as optimistic as it is expected", and it is necessary to "seriously study the future economic situation and persist in the management of financial resources with prudence." Game and other stories Regarding the game sector, which has continued to have a predominant weight in the economy, Sam Hou Fai confirmed a month ago that concessionaires and satellite casinos have until the end of the year to prepare the transition to a subconsers' exploration model. It will be in the "hands" of the dealers to decide whether or not to explore these casinos directly. For Sales Marques, this dossier “worries several sectors of society, not only about the use of its workers, but also for the repercussion that will close in the areas of the city where they are, especially in retail and restoration trade, small trade in general”. Thus, "it will be prudent to avoid great shocks in the current conjuncture." "Everything will be done to regularize these units under the law in force, without provoking their immediate closure," he added. Lou Shenghua hopes to “have room for negotiation about the distribution of revenues between the satellite casinos and the dealers”. Despite the concerns that reside in the unemployment of these people, Sam Hou Fai advanced in March to TDM that these fears can be removed. "I know that satellite casinos workers are distributed to the game companies, so operators have the responsibility of absorbing them or having plans for these workers," he said. Laws for I want you Given the history of Sam Hou Fai in court, as it has presided over the court of last instance since the establishment of the MSAR, some new measures can be expected in the area of ​​law. Sales Marques deposits expectations in the creation of new regulations “that are more facilitators to the operation of the economy”, quite “more favorable to the competitive business environment of this Great Bay region, namely as to the hiring of qualified human resources, conditions offered to their stay and that of their families and less bureaucratic administratives”. Lou Shenghua believes it could, in fact, “pay more attention to legal reform,” although it should be in accordance with government policies and follow the pace of times, not being reformed just because yes, ”he said.

item.title: Peter Kogler, artist: “The visual language I use is universal”
item.description:
Peter Kogler is the artist chosen for a new showcase in the design and architecture studio Impromptu Projects, by Rita Machado and João Ó, inaugurated tomorrow. Until December 31 this year it will be possible to see, in “Peter Kogler: Showroom”, at Travessa de Inácio Baptista, the works of this international artist who innovated by gluing the world of technology and computers to art, creating a new artistic language
How do you feel about presenting your work in Macau? Unfortunately I was never in Macau. I was contacted about two or three years ago by Rita and João [Rita Machado and João Ó] to participate in a project, I saw the things they were developing, and that seemed very interesting to me. We had a conversation and from then on we knew that there was a hypothesis of doing a joint project in the future. But only now can we realize it. What kind of jobs does this shower bring? It is an interesting façade with a mosaic, where there is a showcase and we did a wallpaper installation, which is a kind of façade continuity, as if it were a distorted grid. We have after the LED fans with two globes that run in all directions in a chaotic way. It is a kind of street exhibition because it is in a showcase. Is it to you a different way of presenting your work with the public? I have already exposed in various museums and spaces, and exposed in a more classic way, so to say, with exhibitions. But I also did a lot of projects in the so -called public space, such as metro or train stations. That's why I'm now in Naples, because I'm working on a project for a huge metro station in partnership with an architect. As an artist, how do you feel more comfortable showing your work? In a museum, or in a public space? I like to work in both ways. It must be borne in mind that when you do a project in public space, people have no choice. They have to cross a metro station or a train station [and see the exposed project]. But when you go to a gallery or museum, it's a conscious decision of someone who knows he will confront the art exposed there. This is the main difference. Therefore, we have a different audience when we work in a public space, and we have to adjust our visual language to a specific situation. It is considered one of the pioneers of computational art and the integration of a digital environment in art. How did you decide that this was the way to follow as an artist? When I was just a young artist in 1984, I went to an office machines fair in Vienna. I remember when Apple's Macintosh was presented, the first computer that had an icon-based user interface, in graphic information. It was thus the first machine in which the user did not have to have any kind of programming about programming, one could use Macintosh quite intuitively. This was, of course, a paradigmatic change, and it was evident that it would change the way images are produced and how they are communicated. This was one of the aspects that influenced me. Another has to do with the fact that, in art history, computers have no presence at that time, that is, there was not much to do at that time, so the opportunity to create a kind of new visual language was quite good. These were the two main reasons that led me to choose this means as my main tool. Currently, with Artificial Intelligence (IA), there is a whole new universe that can be explored artistically. Well, I believe it will change our lives at various levels, it will affect the entire social context. The internet was, by itself, a big change, and social networks also came to change a lot. AI is not just something with an impact on art, but in our entire lives. What kind of messages are transmitted with your work? There is no specific type of message, I would say. When we work with computers and use them as a visual tool we are linked to all other domains where this type of digital media plays a role. Therefore, it is an area that tells us something about a particular situation at a certain historical moment.

What was first, the first to step on the head of Ao, originated a saying to indicate a successful feat-Duzhan aotou, "seize the head of Ao." The descendants of the emperor, during the Qing Dynasty designated in Manchu A-G, were not subject to this examination, but their study regime was no less demanding. Since three in the morning studying, among others the four books and the five classics, without vacation, with only five days free a year. One of the most brilliant heirs of this dynasty was Aisin-Tei Hongli, which between 1735-95 would occupy the throne of the dragon son with the name Qianlong. An episode of his biography confirms him when he impressed his powerful grandfather, Emperor Kangxi (1654-1722). He was then twelve years old when he first found him at the Pony Pavilion of the former Yuanmingyuan Summer Palace, the "Garden of the Perfect Brightness." At the time he recited by color the poem of Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073) in praise of the lotto, the flower that is born for beauty, indifferent to the sludge from where it comes. When in turn became emperor, the grandson remembered the grateful meeting with his grandfather named two places where he took place; The Peonial Garden Pavilion began to "the moon emerging, the clouds move away", and the place where he studied with him, "wind and pines between a myriad of valleys." Usually it also remembered the place by ordering the glorious morning painting during Guxian, the third lunar month (ink and silk color, 179.4 x 106.2 cm, at the National Palace Museum in Taipei). Yu Xing (1736-1795), born in the Yushan Hill in Changshu (Jiangsu), the author of this panel, was a painter of the qianlong court who had distinguished in thorough paintings from flowers, plants, insects and fish. In a horizontal roll that made under the theme fish and algae (paint and color on paper, 28.5 x 157.8 cm, sold on Sotheby's), Qianlong wrote a poem proving his appreciation: Green algae like jade scattered throughout the lake and fish swimming free between algae. This scene makes me think in the uselessness of our life. Observing the fish having fun gives me a great joy. The classic Zhuangzi states, without explaining the reason for words, that the life of the fish is really jublishing. item.title: Book | Mark O'Neill tells the history of Europeans in the early days of Hong Kong
item.description:
“Europeans in Hong Kong” is the 18th and new book by British writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, who lives in the neighboring region. At HM, he confesses that he began to write the history of the Irish, but the project eventually expanded. As such, it focused on the stories of Europeans who left their brand in Hong Kong, including Portuguese
Hong Kong, the city of banking, finance and commerce, a worldwide warehouse for centuries and a gateway to China. It has been the neighboring region throughout the time, since its institution, in 1841. Hong Kong has always been an international territory populated by Europeans of various nationalities, much more than the British who administered the territory until 1997. It was missing to tell its story, and Mark O'Neill, British author and journalist, residing in Hong Kong since the late 1970s, has now done so with “Europeans in Hong Kong”, which even includes a chapter about the Portuguese. In another work that has just left the newsstands, the author confesses to HM who began to write the history of the Irish in Hong Kong, whose contribution to the "was huge" territory. This work was not published, being born later the idea of ​​doing something bigger. “I chose the figures that made the greatest contributions, especially at the religious level, or teachers, writers, great figures in the business world and those whose legacies still last,” he confessed. Mark O'Neill points out that the great contribution of Europeans in the neighboring region took place in the educational area, but not only. "The most lasting contribution was given by schools, universities, hospitals, homes of elderly, social assistance institutions and some companies. Although they are entities that are currently managed, largely, by people from Hong Kong, were founded and fed by Europeans." The author explains that the most impressive story associated with the legacy of the French arises on the cover of the book. "In the nineteenth century, the French nuns adopted tens of thousands of Chinese girls who had been abandoned and gave them a good life. Without them, girls would have died or worked as child labor, maids or prostitutes," he said. Another house Asked about the new perceptions that the book can bring to the general public, Mark O'Neill understands that he is "familiar with the history of the British in Hong Kong, but not with the history of continental Europe." Thus, the author says he hopes that "the book will help them understand their history, especially their contribution." In general terms, "in the early decades [of the Hong Kong Foundation], Europeans were, above all, business men and missionaries, both Catholic and Protestants." Then the region grew “as a great Asian city and, from the 1950s, the community expanded.” "Currently, we have architects, engineers, musicians, teachers, restaurant owners, doctors, lawyers, art and people experts in all the domains of life," said the author. Another prominent figure in “Europeans in Hong Kong” is the Jesuit Hungarian Father Laszlo Ladany, considered the “China's greatest observer in the world for thirty years”, and Anders Nelson, “Swedish singer and long-standing resident in Hong Kong, well known to local inhabitants”, describes the introduction of the work. “Most people think that Hong Kong was built by the Chinese during their 150 years of British dominance, which is not entirely accurate. As the reader will discover, many of the schools, social assistance institutions, buildings and companies in the city were founded and managed by people from Europe (defined here as 'east of calais'). They forced it, ”is described in the same introduction. Mark O'Neill also describes that the Hong Kong cemeteries contain traces of this presence, as "Europeans have enjoyed the city and their people more than their homeland." The European presence increased in the neighboring region from 1949, when the People's Republic of China is founded, as "the new Chinese government closed the doors to foreigners, with the exception of a small number of people from other socialist countries." Thus, "eager to remain in China and in the Chinese world, many Europeans have moved from mainland China to Hong Kong," he is mentioned. The Macaense Legacy The fourth chapter is entirely dedicated to the Portuguese and Macaense Hong Kong community, regarded as a “pillar of society” for many years. “For 150 years, the Portuguese were, after the British, the largest non-Chinese community in Hong Kong,” reads the work, which draws the profile of five personalities and describes two social clubs where the community was. Regarding the personalities, the example of José Pedro Braga, the first Portuguese to be part of the Legislative Council, between 1927 and 1937; Sir Roger Lobo, member of the Executive Council between 1967 and 1985; and Commander Arnaldo de Oliveira Sales, first president of the urban council between 1973 and 1981. "The Portuguese played a key role in the government, in banks, the liberal professions and the commercial companies. They lived here for many generations. Most of the expatriates were only the time of their mission; when they renovated, departed and returned to Britain or another country in Europe. book. Regarding the origin of this community, it is described as a “mixed race”, or macanese, but also Portuguese with Asian origins. “Its history dates back to hundreds of years, in the early days of Portuguese trade and exploitation. In the 16th century, Portugal established commercial warehouses and religious missions in Goa, Malaca, Macau and Nagasaki. The Portuguese settlers married local women, creating a mixed root population in India, Malaysia, China and Japan. In 1639, the Japanese government expelled all foreigners and foreigners and isolated the country from the rest of the world. ” Macao emerges closely linked to this community, as it became, in the mid-16th century, “the basis of Portugal in East Asia” after the Dutch blocked Goa and won Malacca. "The Macanese began to form as a cohesive community-sharing ties with Portugal, the Catholic religion, a common language and kitchen and a feeling of distinction from the Portuguese colonials and their Chinese neighbors. They were the only people in Macao who spoke Portuguese and Cantonese, giving them a role of intermediaries essential for the proper functioning of government and business," he is explained. The fact that “the Hong Kong foundation has devastated the economy of Macao” made many macanese began to move from weapons and luggage to a much more brightly saving zone. After all, "just 66 kilometers away [Hong Kong] was the best deep water port in southern China within laws, administration and military protection in the largest empire in the world."

item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like you minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. The EPM question In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several issues that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision made under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, some ideas and opinions on “bilateral exchange and cooperation in the judicial, economic-commercial, education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The head of the executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [tax identification number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, Chinese, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relations for a long time, which changed with Covid. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in immigration in Macao, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this remoteness” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. For the causal, "Misrere does not have to randomly assign more homes, but it is something that corresponds only to my desire." "Of course, the MSAR has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to a greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still a community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It's a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In choosing correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one of green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration. item.title: LAG 2025 | Checks, economy and great bay should be sam hu fai bets
item.description:
The government lines for this year are presented on Monday, marking the debut of Sam Hou Fai in one of the most anticipated moments of the local political calendar. Game recipes and economic predictions should be on the table, according to José Sales Marques and Lou Shenghua. The future of pecuniary checks may be another matter to be in attention
Sam Hou Fai has been in the government for almost five months and is preparing to present, next Monday, his first report of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year. Great expectations often reside in the amounts of pecuniary checks, the values ​​attributed to social support and other budgetary predictions, especially after the territory has been through a hard economic period with Covid-19. LAG 2025 should focus on these themes, and Macao's integration into the various regional cooperation projects, such as Hengqin Island or the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Fulfilling the annual tradition of local politics, Sam Hou Fai made the usual round of auscultations to local associations, in order to know his opinions on the main measures to take. Listened to by HM, economist José Sales Marques expects clarity in the policies announced at the economic level. "I would like to see these LAG bring greater clarity on economic policies and the vision for the future of MSAR. I speak of structural measures that encourage the trust of the private investor, and that also realize such reforms of public administration to increase efficiency and effectiveness," he said. Sales Marques also said that "I would like to clearly see Macao's positions and priorities in his relationship with countries and regions of the world, including measures that lead to deepen the role of Sino-Midfone and Multicultural Dialogue Platform." Lou Shenghua, a political analyst and professor at Macao Polytechnic University (UPM), said the main ideas presented will be in accordance with what Sam Hou Fai presented in the electoral program. "The tonic can be placed in improving the effectiveness of governance, moderate economic diversification, the construction of the Hengqin cooperation zone and the issues related to the subsistence means of people," said the analyst, stressing that "citizens may be more concerned with subsistence -related issues." And what program presented Sam Hou Fai in September last year, when it was glimpsed that he would be the only candidate for the position of Chief Executive? A program that has as its “maximum objective to meet citizens' expectations for a better life” and the “fundamental orientation of implementing the principle of a country, two systems” in a full, correct and firm way ”. The importance of national security was not forgotten, referring to the need for defense “of sovereignty, security and interests of the country's development”. About the sin, Sam Hou Fai said he wanted to erect a "macao based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." The then only candidate to head the government promised to improve the government's governing capacity. "We will strive to raise the capacity and level of governance of MSAR, the change in the concepts of governance, the optimization of the form of governance, the persistence of macao governance in accordance with the law, and the deepening of the reform of public administration and the legal system." Thus, he said "optimizing forms of governance, giving greater importance to the role of advisory bodies, experts and academics, and love associations of the country and Macao, widely listening to the opinions and suggestions of various sectors, different industry branches and various social strata." It remains to be seen if the lag will bring these tin aspects to the field of actions and concrete measures. MATE On Monday, the agenda continues as usual in the presentation of a report of the lag. First Sam Hou Fai will go to the Legislative Assembly, from 15h, make a general presentation to the deputies of political and budgetary issues essential for this year, followed by a press conference. The next day, it is a day of debate in the hemicycle on the same report, then followed the sectoral debates with all secretaries until the 30th of this month. One of the political themes that have been in the DAY ORDER is the value of pecuniary checks and whether or not they are attributed to residents living outside Macao. There are analysts to defend the reformulation of the program, but Sales Marques recalls that "the amount expected for pecuniary checks in the budget discussion for 2025 is 10,000 patacas for permanent residents." “Predicted budget revenues were based on calculation a gross revenue forecast of 240 billion patacas to an average of 20 billion per month. It turns out that the effective revenues obtained until the end of the first quarter of this year were short, with a deviation of less than four billion. be hit. ” Given these less optimistic predictions, referred to by the Secretary himself for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP last week, Sales Marques believes that, if there are adjustments in the checks, will be "small". "As for the distribution method, I predict that it remains the same," he said. Lou Shenghua believes that "the pecuniary reimbursement plan may change." "In terms of amount, it is likely to maintain the value of ten thousand patacas per resident, but regarding the form, it can be attributed to consumer valleys," he said. Last day 1, Secretary Tai Kin IP said the budget accounts are still short of expected. "We noticed that in the first three months of 2025 the gross revenues of the games reached 57.66 billion patacas, remaining the value almost unchanged in annual terms, not yet reaching the expected monthly average of 20 billion patacas." Thus, it was left the warning that "this year's financial revenues may not be as optimistic as it is expected", and it is necessary to "seriously study the future economic situation and persist in the management of financial resources with prudence." Game and other stories Regarding the game sector, which has continued to have a predominant weight in the economy, Sam Hou Fai confirmed a month ago that concessionaires and satellite casinos have until the end of the year to prepare the transition to a subconsers' exploration model. It will be in the "hands" of the dealers to decide whether or not to explore these casinos directly. For Sales Marques, this dossier “worries several sectors of society, not only about the use of its workers, but also for the repercussion that will close in the areas of the city where they are, especially in retail and restoration trade, small trade in general”. Thus, "it will be prudent to avoid great shocks in the current conjuncture." "Everything will be done to regularize these units under the law in force, without provoking their immediate closure," he added. Lou Shenghua hopes to “have room for negotiation about the distribution of revenues between the satellite casinos and the dealers”. Despite the concerns that reside in the unemployment of these people, Sam Hou Fai advanced in March to TDM that these fears can be removed. "I know that satellite casinos workers are distributed to the game companies, so operators have the responsibility of absorbing them or having plans for these workers," he said. Laws for I want you Given the history of Sam Hou Fai in court, as it has presided over the court of last instance since the establishment of the MSAR, some new measures can be expected in the area of ​​law. Sales Marques deposits expectations in the creation of new regulations “that are more facilitators to the operation of the economy”, quite “more favorable to the competitive business environment of this Great Bay region, namely as to the hiring of qualified human resources, conditions offered to their stay and that of their families and less bureaucratic administratives”. Lou Shenghua believes it could, in fact, “pay more attention to legal reform,” although it should be in accordance with government policies and follow the pace of times, not being reformed just because yes, ”he said.

item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." Enquanto isso não acontece, Francisco Manhão continua a lutar por essa e outras bandeiras destinadas a melhorar a vida dos residentes com mais idade, liderando novamente a lista candidata às eleições para a gestão da APOMAC – Associação dos Aposentados, Reformados e Pensionistas de Macau, que decorrem amanhã. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. “É muito difícil encontrar pessoas disponíveis para fazer este trabalho voluntário. Eu e o Jorge gostaríamos de encontrar alguém que nos pudesse substituir, porque estamos há bastante tempo nesta associação. Somos idosos, mas temos energia. Enquanto tivermos força nas pernas para andar, vamos andando e tentar fazer o melhor possível pela APOMAC”, disse Francisco Manhão ao HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension monthly to the elderly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is from the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​sand black. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer have problems of loneliness, and could live with each other, and can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, but lames the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to be able to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the allowance we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would benefit our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. Not long ago one of our associates has waited more than three years for an amount of an amount that was improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked if many elderly from Macau want to pass the renovation in China one day, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

item.title: BOAO FORUM | Ia, globalization and sustainability in discussion
item.description:
Another edition of the Boao Forum began in Haião, where topics such as artificial intelligence, globalization, current economic issues and sustainable development will be discussed. The head of the Executive of Masters departs today for the event, whose theme is “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future”
Posters to announce another edition of the Boao Forum can be seen everywhere in Haião, the Chinese island that hosts the International Forum promoted by Beijing to discuss, with other countries, issues of economic, commercial and cooperation at various levels. The MSAR will be represented by an official delegation led by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, who will be on the island between today and tomorrow. Liu Xianfa, commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the MSAR, continues to join the delegation of MSAR as a guest advisor. The official delegation of the MSAR is also composed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, and the chief executive chief of the cabinet, Chan Kak. During the absence of Sam Hou Fai, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, will interim the functions of Chief Executive. The Boa Goveal Forum for Asia 2025 ends on Friday and has as its theme “Asia in the world in transformation: Towards a shared future” [Asia in the Changing World: Tows a Shared Future], and, according to a statement released by the chief executive's office, focuses on four essential areas, one of them “rebuilding confidence and promoting cooperation in a rapid transformation world”. Objectives are followed by "encouraging growth and rebalanced globalization for inclusive development" or "modeling the future and rapidly implementing the objectives of sustainable development to respond more effectively to global challenges." In turn, the fourth objective concerns a very current area: Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is thus intended to “explore potentialities and intensify AI's application and governance for development motivated by innovation”. According to the People's Daily Journal, this year are expected for more than two thousand participants from 60 countries and regions, being held 50 forums, or discussion groups, around the above objectives. 1,140 journalists are expected to coverage the event. The forecasts of a forum The main conferences of the Boao Forum include discussions about the Chinese and World Economy, namely in "High-Level dialogue: China's reform and economic predictions" and "construction of an open world economy: challenges and solutions." Following is “Improvement of the construction of digital capacity & conforming the gap between digital”, as well as “unlock the great potential of regional free trade agreements”. Among the remaining panels are also conversations about the potential of AI in "AI: how to ensure a balance between application and governance." Countries will also address the issue of global governance in the relationship with the United Nations (UN), in "high-level dialogue: global governance after the UN summit of the future." But the discussion forums start with some predictions made in the report released in the context of the Boao Forum, entitled "Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress". One of the forecasts is that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Asian continent should grow 4.5 percent this year, reported Xinhua. "Despite growing global economic uncertainty, Asia remains a key growth engine for the world economy," the report says. In addition, in terms of parity of purchasing power, the Asia GDP ratio, within the world total, is expected to increase from a registration of 48.1 percent last year to 48.6 percent this year. In turn, the report describes that the general situation of employment and wages “is improving in Asia”, with an unemployment rate of 4.39 percent for this year, less than the global rate of 4.96 percent. The Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress also highlights foreign investments in Asia, describing that China and Asean-Association of Southeast Asia nations "are the most appealing economies in Asia." In addition, it refers that the dependence on the internal and external foreign direct and external investment of Asian economies in the region itself reached 49.15 percent by 2023. From the point of view of the bidirectional dependence of IDE in Asia, China continued to be the most dependent economy of the Asian IDE flows, followed by Indonesia, with its dependence rates over 80 percent and 75 percent, respectively. The report also pointed out that China remains the center of global production value chains, and since 2017, global trade in intermediate goods has been more dependent on China than in North America. In 2023, China's global dependence on intermediate goods was 16 percent compared to 15 percent to North America. The commercial friction caused by the United States in 2018 did not raise their position in the global value chains of the transforming industry, the report added. Thus, the advance of Asia is also described in the level of emerging green technologies, since this is "driven by strong industrial capabilities and political support." Thus, the continent seems to be positioning itself "as a potential leader in advanced materials related to batteries or production of biodegradable plastics." China, Japan, and the Republic of Korea dominate the Lithium Battery Battery Technology Global Supply Chain, a factor considered crucial for the electrification of transport, the report underlines. However, China is at the forefront of the expanding green hydrogen industry in Asia, being the region responsible for almost 70 percent of the worldwide capacity of hydrogen electrolisters, also reveals the same report. An ecological island According to an Xinhua report, Haião Island, which welcomes the Boao Forum, is “a pioneer in development with low carbon emissions”, namely the use of photovoltaic energy. "On Dongyu Island, in Hainan province, southern China, the almost null carbon emissions demonstration zone is redefining harmony between humanity and nature-remodeling modern life through the integration of cutting-edge technology with sustainable development," he describes. But there are more technological news, such as the use of "a simple QR code that unlocks a coffee carbon emissions experience, and where a robotic arm prepares coffee using clean energy." There is also the bet on recycling, as "an advanced recycling cube separates the materials, converting them into" carbon points ", which can be changed to ecological awards." The area that welcomes the Boao Forum has a total area of ​​190 hectares, where a bet on “three key strategies” was made, namely the “renewal of ecological buildings, use of renewable energy and ecological transport”. The renewal of the zone for more sustainable bets will have begun in 2022, being proof of “how technological innovation and urban renewal can shape a future with low carbon emissions, paving the way for sustainable development, particularly in the tropical regions of the world,” says Xinhua. Also according to the same report, "one of the main strengths of the area lies in energy production capacity", currently producing "about 32 million kWh of green electricity, almost double its search for 17 million kWh". In turn, "surplus energy is introduced into the network, contributing to an annual savings of 7 720 tons of negative carbon resources," he said to Xinhua Ouyang Qinglun, deputy director of the Cosco Shipping Boao Co.
