item.title: History | Lara Reis, Professor of Macao High School, remembered in Lisbon
item.description:
The former teacher of the Macao High School Fernando Lara Reis was remembered in the “Spring Conferences”, from the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center, by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira. A native of Leiria, Lara Reis fought in the 1st World War and lived on Avenida da República, in the villa that today houses the Macau Red Cross house
Fernando Lara Reis was born in 1892 and died in 1950. Throughout a life filled with historical events and testimonies, the natural man of Leiria was a military man and a teacher at Macao High School, eventually making the territory his home. Lara Reis's life was recently remembered at the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira, herself to her former teacher in the territory. At the session, the historian, who won the 2024 Macao International Institute Identity Award (IIM), recalled the “teacher, meritorious, driving of the arts”, and owner of “unusual knowledge”. “He was a native of Leiria and lived in Macao until his death. He attended Leiria High School, the Military College, then joined the Army School. In World War I was in Elvas, and then left to Angola in 1915 when he faced the German threat over Portuguese colonies in Africa. Observer-Aviator. ” Lara Reis was never a pilot as she wanted, having dedicated much of her life to teaching and Macao. “In 1919, Lara Reis went to Macao High School. He took a long circum-gap trip, leaving Portugal from Lisbon, going to the United States of America, crossed the entire territory and then went to Japan, down to Hong Kong and even Macau. He was a teacher in Macao, drawing, handicrafts and gymnastics until the end of his life,” said Celina Veiga de Oliveira. The historian took to the session some written testimonies left by other Macao figures who wrote about Lara Reis, namely Monsignor Manuel Teixeira in the book “Macao Lyceu”. He said he never found "no teacher who had served the High School with greater dedication." “He was a rigorous methodical teacher, whose military formation was certainly not oblivious to these characteristics. What was truly standing out was his artistic vein, because Lara Reis was always concerned with ascertaining the aesthetic meaning of the students and opening their mental horizons. This at the time when Macau was a small town. that he organized and also exhibitions by Portuguese and foreign artists he sponsored, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira also highlighted the words left by the writer Henrique de Senna Fernandes in an interview on "one of the greatest qualities of Lara Reis", which "besides rigor and discipline, was the consideration by the students, not distinguishing rich from the poor." Professor Lara Reis was "a party prosecutor who served to obtain tuition fees for needy students," and "he is due to the initiative of the creation of the High School Association, of which he was the first president." This association organized in the former canhydrome “sports parties of the end of the year when students performed the most difficult exercises”. Work done in Macau The historian also highlighted “another aspect of dedication to territory” by Lara Reis. The Leiriense "participated in the First World War and this led him to interest all those who were incorporated into this conflict, having founded the League of the Great War fighters and had built in the cemetery of St. Miguel Archangel the monument where the bodies of combatants rest." Moreover, "another facet of his personality was a taste for travel, because he had no family and thus left for the world." "I visited museums, art schools and photographed everything I saw, having created a estate with 32 volumes that is now a heritage of Leiria." Celina Veiga de Oliveira did not forget the old “Sol Pente” villa, located in the middle-leaf zone, namely the Avenida da República, which was the house of Lara Reis, later donated to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao to “an anti-cancer clinic that was the first institution of the genre in the Portuguese colonial space”. Today this villa serves as a house to the Red Cross of Macao, and on its walls you can find a stone with the following message: “In this building legacy by the Rotary Fernando Reis to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao, it was installed at the initiative of the Rotary Club of Macao the first anti-cancer fighting center on April 15, 1951.” “Change of Ares” When Fernando Lara Reis goes to Macao, political times are troubled, with the political agitation to be lived in China after the fall of the Empire and the Republican Revolution of 1911. "In the 1920s the nationalist shock waves lived in the Canton, which sometimes haunted the Portuguese enclave quiet, but never moved with everyday life. The Portuguese administration guaranteed a standard appearance, and the parties at Christmas, Chinese New Year, the religious festivities of the Catholic community and the Chinese population were habitual." Celina Veiga de Oliveira recalled that in the late 1920s, Lara Reis decided to transfer to Goa, a trip that would only accentuate her belonging to Macau. “In the late 1920s, he felt he was time to change his air and asked to be transferred to the Afonso de Albuquerque High School in Pangim, and was there between 1941 and 1945, taking the opportunity to know India, and met the whole country. Instead, with a graceful and already sick license, choosing Macau to be his last address, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira recordou também as palavras de Orlando Cardoso, que no artigo “Macau e o Oriente na vida de Lara Reis” falou do homem que se deslumbrou com Macau “a partir do momento em que, às 8 horas da noite de 23 de Outubro de 1919, avistou pela primeira vez o Farol da Guia, um pouco antes de se instalar no ‘New Macao Hotel’ e sorver de sentidos atentos os sons, os cheiros e as luzes desta porta of an immeasurable and fantastic Asia that he would describe to exhaustion. ” These Lara Reis testimonies are “in a remarkable set of travel books that lay virtually unexplored in all their research potentialities on the shelves of the Leiria District Archive”, and were investigated by Orlando Cardoso himself. In the same article, this one refers to a text from the newspaper “News of Macau” of January 17, 1950, about Lara Kings: “The Auster and Worsen Teacher; the tenacious and thorough tourist; the military who fought and consecrated the memory of those who fell in the field of struggle; the honest and firm friend; the lovely and humorous companion; social celibate that, despite this, did not disdain any opportunity to undo its gallants, always kind and inconsequential to any palm with a face that in the goto ”. Given the few studies that exist about Lara Reis and the estate he left, Celina Veiga de Oliveira left a suggestion: "May the CCCM get the detailed index of the Leiria Archive, so that the research is possible for any interested researchers."

item.title: Caeal | Requested exemption from schools during electoral act
item.description: The Commission on Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) has organized a session with various educational institutions to remember the need for schools to respect the “principles of justice, impartiality and integrity in the elections”. The initiative was invited by the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). With several schools linked to government -funded associations that present candidate lists for elections, cases of election campaign through students, as with the delivery of leaflets, are not uncommon. For this reason, Caeal highlighted the need for the directions to ensure that schools remain on the sidelines of the electoral act. The chairman of the committee, Judge Seng Ioi Man, stressed in the session that "public schools must maintain a neutral position, and that their employees should also maintain a neutral position before the various application lists, during the execution of their tasks, not being able to proceed electoral advertising during the time or working space." Regarding private schools, the official argued that “electoral law does not specifically regulate private schools in the field of electoral propaganda”, but that internal guidelines “must be decided and applied by the private schools themselves, but always in accordance with the law and carried out within the period of electoral propaganda”.

item.title: Employment | Ella Law asks for more help to young and elderly
item.description: Deputy Ella Lei argues that the government needs to launch more support for the use of young people and older people. This is how the deputy linked to the workers earned the presentation of the first lines of governing action (LAG) of the Sam Hou Fai government, which take place next Monday. According to the newspaper or Mun, the deputy expects the government to launch new subsidies, training courses and create new job opportunities for these groups. Ella Law recalled that Sam Hou Fai highlighted the guarantee of residents' work rights as one of their priorities of the mandate, leaving the hope that the government revises the number of labor authorizations granted to non -residents. In this chapter, law expects more incentives for places to take on head positions, especially in large companies. In addition, Ella Lei wants the government to reinforce the fight against illegal workers, citing the complaints of residents that in construction, restoration, or drivers it is normal to exist illegal workers and in recent years still enter other sectors such as conventions and exhibitions, tourism and filming.

item.title: Housing | Request support for those in the waiting list
item.description:
In the middle of the electoral pre-campaign, Nick Lei has insisted on the subject of housing. The deputy released yesterday a written interpellation where he asks for the return of the allowance for those who wait for a social housing fraction, and the reduction of waiting time for the delivery of a home
For more than three months from the beginning of the campaign for the next elections that will select the future cast of the Legislative Assembly, Nick Lei seems to have chosen one of his priorities: public housing. After on Monday, the deputy linked to the Fujian community released a response from the Housing Institute to a written interpellation on economic housing, yesterday was the turn to address social housing. Nick Law insists on the return of the subsidy to help pay the income to candidates waiting for a fraction. The so -called “residence allowance” was created in Edmund Ho's second term in government leadership, to help families who met the criteria for access to a social housing, but who were on the waiting list because there is no available apartments. In the last round of the support, in 2022, the amount of the subsidy was 1,650 patacas per month, for aggregates with one or two members, and 2,500 patacas per month, for household aggregates with more than two people. The deputy acknowledges that in the near future, the supply of social housing may satisfy the demand. But for now, there are those who have been waiting for a fraction for over two and a half years. "It should be noted that families who expect social housing are all composed of economically disadvantaged residents. Although the government has ensured that the waiting for a fraction was reduced to a year after the implementation of the permanent candidacy mechanism, this continues not to reflect real wait between the various types of apartment typology," said the deputy.
More worthwhile Nick Law sets the example of the social housing apartment candidates, which largely exceed the offer. But it admits that the blocks of this type of public housing in zone A of new landfills, which must be completed between 2026 and 2027, can help solve the situation by offering about 4,088 apartments, of which 3,276 are T1. In addition, also the Avenida Venceslau de Morais Social Housing Complex, the Mong Son Building will help to bridge the gaps on the side of the offer. This building consists of three blocks, with 24 to 35 floors, three floors in a basement, providing 885 T1 typology fractions and 705 T2 typology fractions, totaling 1,590 social housing fractions. The deputy argues that the financial pressure caused by the lease market seriously affects the poorest families, especially compared to the annual rise of 3.9 percent of the income averages last year. Another of the deputy's demands is the maximum guarantee that the government gave four years, between the moment a social housing candidacy is accepted and the delivery of a home. Nick Law would like this warranty period to be reduced.

item.title: Road Works | Au Kam San criticizes administration
item.description: Former Deputy Au Kam San criticizes the bureaucracy of the working group for the optimization of the Coordination of Road Works, launched by the Chief Executive. In a Facebook publication, Au Kam San understands that the creation of this public organism will not solve the problem of road works, having described that, despite this new group being led by the secretary for transport and public works, Raymond Tam, maintains the same ideas as the previous executive. In addition, the former deputy recalled the creation of another similar entity, the road works supervision group. "The joke that can be associated with this bureaucratic system is that if a group cannot do a job well, there will be another. If this work remains not done, there will always be another group and added service," he wrote. Au Kam San concluded that the problem of road works has existed since the establishment of MSAR, so it does not believe that it can be resolved through “improvements” and “coordination” with working groups. However, the second meeting of the working group was held yesterday to optimize the Coordination of Road Works, and Raymond also said, according to an official note, that “the government will require the promoter to reserve the spaces for the installation of channeling during the execution of the works, with a view to reducing the possibility of repeated excavations on public roads”. "Instructions for members of the working group and channeling companies were given to reduce the deadline for execution of works and apply more technology in order to minimize the impact on residents and retailers."

item.title: Tobacco | Residents want clarification of smokers zones
item.description: The General Union of Macao Residents Associations (Ugamm) argues that the government should more visibly demarcate the zones for smokers, removing them from the areas of the highest affluence of tourists. The position was taken by Che Mei Leng, vice president of Ugamm, in statements to the newspaper Exmooo. In a reaction to government plans to create a smoking zone near the ruins of Sao Paulo, Che indicates that it is necessary to keep in mind that smoke tends to spread and therefore should be avoided by affecting the other tourists, residents and traders of the zone. The official asks the area to be created far from the large concentrations of visitors. However, residents' deputy also recognizes that it is natural that smokers do not want the area to be far away from the main attractions. For this reason, Che Mei Leng considers that the government has to find a balance between the benefits for the residents of the zone and the interests of smokers. Che Mei Leng also suggested that a transitional period be implemented before punishments are applied so that tourists can be well informed about the consequences of their acts. At the same time, Che called the government to promote the dissemination of the measure on social networks.

item.title: Economic Housing | Permanent candidacy is again removed
item.description:
With attention focused on competitions for economic housing launched and 2019, 2021 and 2023, the Housing Institute removes the hypothesis allow permanent candidates. Regarding the five suspended housing projects in zone A of the new landfills, the government remains without construction plans
The Housing Institute (IH) is concentrated “in the work of appreciation and attribution of applications to Economic Housing of 2019, 2021 and 2023”. As such, it is not being weighted, in the short term, the permanent candidacy for economic housing, since it is necessary to comprehensively consider social changes and other factors, ”said the president of IH, iam Leng Leng, in response to a written interpellation of Nick Law. The deputy linked to the community of Fujian has insisted on the reform of housing policies, in particular in his flexibility. Nick Law stressed that there is no mechanism in the law that allows the exchange of housing fractions, a situation that penalizes individual candidates who cannot change their home even if over the contest marry or have children. Also on the possibility of changing home, I were Leng Leng has not advanced a concrete position, merely answering that the government will optimize housing policies and that it has launched a study on the viability of the economic housing exchange regime. The deputy asked when the study would be completed and if his results will be released, but the president of IH did not respond. Good zone A year ago, the then secretary for transport and public works, Raimundo do Rosario, revealed in the Legislative Assembly that the government would suspend the construction of six residential economic housing complexes in zone A of new landfills, which would add 5,700 apartments to the city's housing park. It should be noted that Raimundo do Rosario revealed the suspension in response to an oral interpellation of Nick Law. A year later, the deputy re -interrogated the government on construction and development projects. The president of the HI replied that, "taking into account the situation of candidacies for economic housing verified in the last two contests, the Government of MSAR, after evaluation, decided to suspend the development of economic housing projects in lots A13, B13, B14, B15 and B16, and there is no new plans for now."

item.title: Science Center | Subsidies cover losses of 141 million
item.description: Last year, the Macao Science Center presented operational losses of 141 million Patacas, which had to be covered by government subsidies. The data are contained in the latest results of the company's Mok Ian Ian -managed company results and detained 100 percent by MSAR. According to the figures presented, the operations of the Science Center generated losses of 141.0 million patacas. This number indicates losses above those registered in the previous year, which had been 121.8 million patacas. In operational terms, the Science Center registered 16.1 million patacas in revenues, which were added 1.4 million generated with capital interest, and 3.2 million classified as other revenues. At the same time, the expenses were 161.8 million Patacas, more 16 million than 2023, when they had been 145.8 million patacas. The main expenses were made with personnel costs, in the amount of 64.5 million patacas. Mok Ian Ian, as president of the institution, has an annual salary of nearly 1.6 million patacas. The second largest expense arises classified as “depreciation and amortization” in the amount of 50.5 million patacas. The third largest expense was due to advertising, in the amount of 9.2 million. In turn, the Government delivered subsidies of 141 million Patacas, including operations allowance, in the amount of 90.5 million patacas, allowance for acquisition of goods, 39.2 million patacas, and subsidy for special projects, worth 11.3 million patacas. By 2023, the climbed had been 121 million patacas, a difference of 20 million patacas.

item.title: The psychology of attraction at first sight
item.description: "Attraction at first sight" is a phenomenon that fascinates everyone. The romantic comedies portray it as an instant and uncontrollable moment between two people. It is now necessary to unravel the possible explanations behind this phenomenon, resorting to two major schools of thought: cognitive psychology-which develops empirical methodologies to test hypotheses on the subject-and the psychodynamic approach-that works with interpretative bases. Both perspectives build metaphors that help us interpret these processes. Thus, we can oscillate between two proposals: will at first glance be a product of deeply rooted unconscious mechanisms or, on the contrary, a posteriori romantic construction, based on sensory and cognitive processes? Cognitive psychology suggests that "attraction at first sight" can result from rapid processing of sensory and emotional information. The human brain is programmed to recognize standards and categorize information efficiently, allowing us to evaluate someone in fractions of second, based on facial traits, expressions or body language. Studies on social perception confirm that we formulate immediate judgments about others. From a biological point of view, this phenomenon may be linked to activation of the dopaminergic system, responsible for the regulation of pleasure and reward. When we find someone we consider attractive, the brain releases dopamine, triggering a desire for proximity. In addition, investigation into pheromonas indicate that we are unconsciously attracted by partners whose immune system complements ours, favoring genetic diversity in descent. On the other hand, the psychodynamic approach, rooted in Sigmund Freud's psychoanalysis, explains the attraction at first sight through unconscious mechanisms. From this perspective, past experiences - especially those of childhood - shape our standards of attraction. When we feel instantly attracted to someone, it may be because this person acts memories or emotions associated with primary linking figures such as parents or caregivers. Attraction does not focus on the other as a real person, but in the way he resonates within our unconscious structure of desire. The other can symbolize something we lack, something interdict or an emotional issue not yet resolved. This mechanism, known as projective identification, explains how we can feel a strong attraction to someone who unconsciously represents significant parts of our psychic history. According to this theory, we rarely fall in love with those who really are, but by the way we project in it our unresolved emotional needs. The attraction is therefore a meeting of unconscious, where both project family standards in each other. Of course beliefs also shape romantic expectations. If we believe that instant attraction is a sign of destination, we tend to attribute to it emotional meaning. The impact of culture and social norms shows how the perception of “love at first sight” can be influenced by romanticed narratives. For example, in books, movies or advertising romanticizes the idea of ​​attraction at first glance, creating a narrative that leads people to idealize and expect intense and immediate emotional links. This cultural expectation can influence the way we interpret real encounters-if someone lives in tune with romantic ideals, it is more likely to attribute emotional meaning to an instant attraction, facing it as something "intended to happen" or "predestined". Cognitive psychology faces the phenomenon more pragmatically, almost stripping it of its romanticism: it all depends on our mental processing and what we consider relevant. Psychoanalysis, on the other hand, articulates the cross between fantasy and reality, proposing that although the attraction at first glance is composed of projective and fanciful elements, they are not totally dissociated from the meeting itself. There is something significant in this dynamic; Otherwise, people would not fall in love. As a psychoanalyst would say, we are attracted to those who can nourish our psychic wounds-which later may reveal the cause of dysfunctions in the couple. There is an intangible domain that subtly communicates who we are, where we have come from and how we can complete. In short, while neuroscience and cognitive psychology highlight automatic and hormonal reactions, psychodynamics emphasizes the role of unconscious and past experiences. Although cognitive and psychodynamic psychology can seem opposite-one focusing on conscious and observable processes and the other in unconscious and emotional mechanisms-there is potential for overlap, and recognizing it could make explanation more robust. The cognitive perspective on attraction, which emphasizes rapid and automatic judgments based on physical signals and emotional responses, can be understood as the initial and superficial processing that is complemented by unconscious processes. But my proposal is another: show that the way we look at the phenomenon affects the way we live it. Each explanation can better adapt to each person's experiences. Is the attraction at first glance rooted in an authentic and deep desire, or is it an illusion fueled by the human need for connection and meaning? The answer may reside in each other's imagination and wealth. Ultimately, the way we interpret the phenomenon of “attraction at first sight” can be deeply influenced by the brain and unconscious mechanisms discussed, but also by the cultural narratives we internalize. Thus, experience will always be an intersection between what we feel and how we learn to feel.

item.title: Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (II)
item.description: Last week, we debated the Independent Commission Against Corruption of Hong Kong (HKICAC) (Hong Kong Against Corruption Committee) and Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (HKIAAC) (HGO KONG ACADEMY AGAINST CORRUPTION) and we introduced their origins succinctly. Macao Commissioner against Corruption, (CCAC). In 1975, during the Portuguese administration of Macao, the fight against corruption was carried out by the Judicial Police. In 1992, the then government of Macao created the High Commissioner against corruption and administrative illegality. Referring to Hong Kong's experience, which had become one of the most impollowing places in the world, when writing Macau's Basic Law, it was clearly stipulated that CCAC would have to be created. One of the most illustrative cases is that of Man Long: “Investigating the case of corruption A to Man Long began in 2005, when during the investigation of a corruption case based on information available in the meantime, CCAC found that the then secretary for transport and public works was involved in suspicion of abuse of power. This shows that CCAC has achieved extraordinary results in its work to combat corruption. In 2006, the International Association of Anti-Corruption Authorities (Iaaca) was created in Beijing. It is the first international anti-corruption organization in the world with agencies from various member countries. It aims to actively promote the “United Nations Convention against Corruption” and reinforce international cooperation between counterparts from various countries. Cao Jianming, Attorney General of China's Supreme Popular Attorney's Office, was elected president of IAACA twice, on November 5, 2010 and November 24, 2013. The mandate of the IAACA President is three years. On January 5, 2022, the Commission Commission Commission against Hong Kong Corruption, Ba Yunliu, was elected as a new president. Later, Ba Yunliu retired. On September 1, 2023, Hu Yingming assumed the position of president of IAACA. IAACA has a “Federation Secretariat”, created by HKICAC on January 6, 2022 to support the HKICAC Commissioner in the exercise of his duties as president of IAACA. The main responsibility of the Federation Secretariat is to support or organize activities. HKIAAC is affiliated with the HKICAC International Cooperation and Institutional Affairs Division and performs part of the federation secretariat's duties. Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee believes that, in addition to cooperating with China's work and anti-corruption policies, HKICAC also cooperates with organizations around the world to jointly promote the global anti-corruption cause. HKICAC can help improve the fight against corruption in Hong Kong, promote the region's unpolluted environment and promote the stability, integrity and rule of law of Hong Kong society. Currently, HKICAC has already trained in over 70 countries. In February 2024, HKICAC coorganized a “International Anti-Corruption Course on Financial Investigation and Pursuit of Fugitives and Stolen Assets”, lasting nine days, in collaboration with the “Operational Network of Agencies for the Anti-Corruption Law of the United Nations Drug and Crime Law”. In March 2024, HKICAC opened a five-day anti-corruption course for more than 90 employees from the “illegal enrichment office” in Mali, covering topics such as research techniques, integrity management and public education. In early April 2024, HKICAC sent staff to Kazakhstan in Central Asia to conduct courses to nearly 200 local anti-corruption agencies. In May 2024, HKICAC signed a memo of cooperation with the United Nations and Crime Operational Network of Application Agencies. In May 2025, it assisted it in the writing of the “Prison Corruption Risk Management Guidelines”. A HKICAC spokesman pointed out: “HKICAC values ​​operability that combines theory with practice, actively fulfills its anti-corruption mission, builds an international platform for integrity, promotes the development of the anti-corruption cause globally, and unequivocally contributing to its advancement worldwide.” HKICAC has provided several anti-corruption formations in many countries and worked hard to combat global corruption. These achievements were made under the leadership of China. From now on, HKICAC will not only continue to compete with this work, but its existence will speak for the history of China and Hong Kong. item.title: Jurist Cristina Ferreira presents today book at FRC
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) hosts today, from 6.30 pm, the presentation of the new book of jurist Cristina Ferreira, entitled “Legal Statute of Gafi in the international order”, edited by Brill. The event takes place in the scope of the “Reflections on Afternoon” lectures, and has the moderation of Paulo Cardinal, jurist and teacher. Both teach at the University of Macao Law School. The event aims to make known the premises of the book “The Legal Status of the Financial Action Task Force in the International Legal System”, released in January, and the conference on the “Evolution of the International Financial Financial Action Group (Gafi) legal status, based on the bold argument that Gafi gradually evolved into an international organization, addressing this issue of international law. and the law of international organizations, combining theory and practice, ”according to the author, cited by a FRC statement. Gafi (FATF) is the worldwide organization responsible for setting international policies and standards in combating capital bleaching, financing terrorism and proliferation of weapons of massive destruction, and the occurrence of other threats to the integrity of the world financial system. Years of Analysis As a legal consultant in international law, the author has witnessed over two decades “gradual metamorphosis, which began to be a specialized technical organism, for a complex and multifaceted organization, whose legitimacy is impaired by the lack of clarity as to its legal position”. The scope of the organization, and the long -reaching impact of its policies and measures, to respond to global trends and threats that pose a risk to the international financial system, as well as how members, non -members, international organizations and other interveners have accepted and implemented them, without a thorough examination (weights and counterweights) and without questioning their legal status, is the reflection that is placed. The theme has special relevance for hearings in the areas of Public International Law, Law of International Organizations or International Institutional Law, International Economic Law, International Relations, and for a potential audience of political, academic, law professionals, lawyers, regulators and students.

item.title: Peter Kogler, artist: “The visual language I use is universal”
item.description:
Peter Kogler is the artist chosen for a new showcase in the design and architecture studio Impromptu Projects, by Rita Machado and João Ó, inaugurated tomorrow. Until December 31 this year it will be possible to see, in “Peter Kogler: Showroom”, at Travessa de Inácio Baptista, the works of this international artist who innovated by gluing the world of technology and computers to art, creating a new artistic language
How do you feel about presenting your work in Macau? Unfortunately I was never in Macau. I was contacted about two or three years ago by Rita and João [Rita Machado and João Ó] to participate in a project, I saw the things they were developing, and that seemed very interesting to me. We had a conversation and from then on we knew that there was a hypothesis of doing a joint project in the future. But only now can we realize it. What kind of jobs does this shower bring? It is an interesting façade with a mosaic, where there is a showcase and we did a wallpaper installation, which is a kind of façade continuity, as if it were a distorted grid. We have after the LED fans with two globes that run in all directions in a chaotic way. It is a kind of street exhibition because it is in a showcase. Is it to you a different way of presenting your work with the public? I have already exposed in various museums and spaces, and exposed in a more classic way, so to say, with exhibitions. But I also did a lot of projects in the so -called public space, such as metro or train stations. That's why I'm now in Naples, because I'm working on a project for a huge metro station in partnership with an architect. As an artist, how do you feel more comfortable showing your work? In a museum, or in a public space? I like to work in both ways. It must be borne in mind that when you do a project in public space, people have no choice. They have to cross a metro station or a train station [and see the exposed project]. But when you go to a gallery or museum, it's a conscious decision of someone who knows he will confront the art exposed there. This is the main difference. Therefore, we have a different audience when we work in a public space, and we have to adjust our visual language to a specific situation. It is considered one of the pioneers of computational art and the integration of a digital environment in art. How did you decide that this was the way to follow as an artist? When I was just a young artist in 1984, I went to an office machines fair in Vienna. I remember when Apple's Macintosh was presented, the first computer that had an icon-based user interface, in graphic information. It was thus the first machine in which the user did not have to have any kind of programming about programming, one could use Macintosh quite intuitively. This was, of course, a paradigmatic change, and it was evident that it would change the way images are produced and how they are communicated. This was one of the aspects that influenced me. Another has to do with the fact that, in art history, computers have no presence at that time, that is, there was not much to do at that time, so the opportunity to create a kind of new visual language was quite good. These were the two main reasons that led me to choose this means as my main tool. Currently, with Artificial Intelligence (IA), there is a whole new universe that can be explored artistically. Well, I believe it will change our lives at various levels, it will affect the entire social context. The internet was, by itself, a big change, and social networks also came to change a lot. AI is not just something with an impact on art, but in our entire lives. What kind of messages are transmitted with your work? There is no specific type of message, I would say. When we work with computers and use them as a visual tool we are linked to all other domains where this type of digital media plays a role. Therefore, it is an area that tells us something about a particular situation at a certain historical moment.
What expectations do you have about the reception of your work in Macau? And what influence can the territory bring to your work? I start by saying that the visual language I use in my work has a very universal character. I work with some elements that can be read in any type of culture, such as the brain, the hands, the globe, tubes. All of these images do not have any kind of specific cultural connotation. I look forward to going to Macau so that I can realize the specific qualities of the territory. I assume that Macao is the result of a very complex situation due to historical circumstances, with the fact that it was a Portuguese colony with China which, at this moment, presents a powerful economic context. There are many influences that intersect there. Throughout his career he has exposed in the main museums and galleries around the world. Did you expect this international recognition? Above all, I think it is a privilege to have the possibility of working at so many different levels and with so many different cultural contexts. It is also a continuous process of learning. Your work is very close to the abstract universe. How do you feel if the public does not understand what they want to convey, or even with negative criticism? Of course I am not happy, but this is part of the work. You know, there are always different opinions, and that's how things are. But do you understand that your work can focus on the abstract level, or am I doing a wrong analysis? There are in fact certain elements in my visual language that present themselves with a kind of abstract tradition. But there are also many elements with connection to things we know, such as the brain or the globe. My work also communicates at different levels, but there are also more direct things, such as the facilities I do most directed to children, for example. Then the children react strongly. This means that information goes quite directly, because it is not something that can be said or explain to them, because children do not exactly have knowledge of art history. What are the great influences on your art? Have these influences change over time? An important aspect is what you can do with technology. I started working with computers in 1984, where there were graphic programs with a specific visual language. But there were very few devices to transfer the elements to other materials, such as screens or wallpapers. Therefore, they were fully analog transfer and production processes, at the level of photography or screen printing, for example. Throughout all these years technology has developed quickly and today any type of element transfer or production is digital, such as projecting computer animations, printing things for facades… It was important to observe all these technical possibilities and understand how I can use them and include in my visual language.

item.title: Architecture | Nuno Soares Proposal for Hac-Sá Beach Wins Prize
item.description: “Park of Tides”, a project led by architect Nuno Soares, from the “Urban Pratice” studio, received the Silver Award in the “Landscape Design - Public Landscape” category in the London Design Awards 2024. The proposal, launched in a public tender by invitation by the Institute for Macao Municipal Affairs in early 2024, aimed to “create an accessible pedestrian route that would connect the two ends of the beach, incorporating simultaneously leisure facilities”, describes the statement. "Park of Tides" is inspired "in the natural rhythm of the tides", having an area of ​​12 thousand square meters, where it reinterprets "the route with an expansion in the form of wave". In this proposal, it is foreseen “a modern, green and accessible space by the sea, which values ​​the natural beauty and recreational value of Hac Sá beach”. Nuno Soares also developed three zones, centered on leisure and interactive spaces, exploration of natural materials and outdoor activities and another place with “design and contemporary facilities”. Thus, together, these three zones "reimagine the riverside area as a multifunctional and inclusive destination for visitors to engage, explore and relax." Cited by the same note, Nuno Soares explained that this project “adopts a minimal impact approach, where permeable structures and natural materials are involved with the terrain”, as well as representing a “commitment” of the studio “with sustainable and inclusive architectural practices, ensuring ecological preservation while increasing the well-being of the community”. The London Design Awards, together with the International Awards Associate, recognize projects that are exceptional and creative influence proposing to promote works of designers involved in various fields, bringing recognition those who overcome the industry.

item.title: Images about China populated New Show from Halftone
item.description: Halftone-Macao Photographic Association inaugurates this Friday a new exhibition dedicated to China's culture and visions. “The Spirit of China” is the name of the show that can be seen on the 3rd floor of The Parisian Macao, in Cotai, from 6.30 pm, being patent until May 11. This collective exhibition brings together the works of 17 photographers based in Macau, which exploit, through strong visual narratives, the evolution of Chinese identity and its contemporary meaning. Names such as João Palla, Sofia Mota, Sara Augusto or Francisco Ricarte, among others. Some are dedicated exclusively to photography, others just make it a hobby. The idea is to reveal this crossing ways of photographing. According to a statement from Halftone, which also publishes a photography magazine, “the show proposes a reflection on how fast urbanization and the emergence of megacities coexist with historical neighborhoods, such as religious rituals and old festivities dialogue with digital culture, and how new generations are redefining what it means to be Chinese in the 21st century”. “With the use of documentary, contemporary and conceptual photography, the works go through time and space-past, present and future imagined-offering deep visions about heritage, urban landmarks and new forms of visual expression,” he adds. Its own dynamic Halftone also points out, in the same note, that “more than a representation of Chinese legacy”, this exhibition “reveals identity as a living force - constantly shaped by social, dynamic diaspora and digital interconnectivity”. “The public is invited to reflect on the coexistence between the old and the new, and to get involved with the spirit of a nation in transformation,” is still mentioned. "The Spirit of China" shows a country that "has undergone an impressive transformation in recent decades, reconfiguring not only its urban horizons and architectural landscapes, but also the very essence of its cultural identity." “Given a rapid modernization and the advancement of technology, a new generation has been building a dynamic dialogue between tradition and innovation,” the note describes.

item.title: AMCM | Securities Deposit and Settlement Center loses 7.18 million
item.description:
The Macao Securities Deposit and Settlement Center, controlled 100 percent by MSAR, continues to record successive losses. Since 2022, the company created to diversify the economy of Macau has never presented profits
Macao's central deposit and settlement company (MCSD) registered losses of 7.18 million patacas last year. This is the second consecutive year with loss of the company controlled 100 percent by the Monetary Authority of Macau (AMCM), which had presented losses of 6.7 million patacas in the previous year. Created in 2021, MCSD emerged within the policy of the Ho IAT SENG government to diversify the economy in the field of finance and has as its functions the exploitation of financial infrastructure, central registration services, compensation, settlement and deposit of securities. Within these functions, MCSD has been supporting the obligation to be borrowed. However, the company's numbers insist on continuing to have damage. In the first full year of operations in 2022, the company that has a corporate capital of 50 million Patacas, had losses of 3.9 million patacas. The following year, the damage rose to 6.7 million patacas and the latest data show a new negative record of 7.18 million patacas. More revenues and expenses Despite the negative scenario, revenues originated by contracts with participants in the financial market of Macau even registered an increase. Currently, on the MCSD portal, about 90 entities appear as “participants”. In 2024, revenues derived from participation contracts rose to 2.9 million patacas, when the previous year had been about 966,000 patacas. In terms of the remaining revenues of last year, a 1 million patacas was calculated in interest, with the other services generated 11,300 patacas and the shift gains generating 721 patacas. In terms of expenses there was also an increase to 11.2 million patacas by 2024, compared to 9.2 million patacas of 2023. The highest cost was for the remuneration of workers from 3.1 million patacas to 4.6 million patacas. For this increase contributed the recruitment of five employees, totaling 13 workers at the end of 2024. The other major expense was due to pay the telecommunications post services that was 3.2 million patacas, below the cost of 3.3 million from the previous year.

item.title: Commerce | Suppliers ask for autonomy to American products
item.description: To avoid the impact of US tariffs, the Macao suppliers' union association advocates greater gradual autonomy from imported products in America. The idea came from the association's president, IP Sio Man, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. According to IP, US dependence is negative because tariff policies are unpredictable and are constantly changing. The official indicated that last year, the value of products Macau exported to the US was 300 million patacas, while the value of imported products from the US was 70 billion patacas. On the other hand, IP Sio Man anticipated that the Macao government is unable to follow the interior in adopting retaliation policies against the US, so it should follow an alternative path. But even though Macau follows the background policy, IP has devalued the case, considering that it will not have great impact, because in recent years, Macau has actively explored new markets and can import products from other regions to replace those of the US.

item.title: Consumption | Confidence index with ambiguous results
item.description:
The consumer confidence rate rose slightly during the third quarter, still remaining close to negative terrain. An inquiry, prepared by Must, demonstrates the increase in confidence in home purchase and financial investments, but a breakdown of confidence in the local economy, employment, prices and evolution of living level
The University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must, Siga Inglesa) published on Monday the latest consumer confidence rate for the first three months of this year, revealing a slight climb of the population's belief in the economic panorama of Macao. The inquiry carried out by the Must Institute for Sustainable Development is based on the analysis of six categories: “price level”, “housing purchase”, “lifestyle”, “employment”, “investments” and “local economy”. Of the six categories, two registered climbs and four descents. According to a statement issued by the team that made the inquiry, the general index increased by 0.85 percent compared to the previous quarter, in a scale between 0 and 200, in 103.82 points, reaching the fourth quarter followed by rise in the overall index. Given the general results, academics consider that the general confidence of Macao consumers is in a phase of stability. It should be noted that in the last three months of 2024, the general index rose 2.54 percent compared to the previous quarter. Point by point Among the six areas analyzed, two recorded reliable climbs in the first quarter of 2025. Trust in the shareholder market and financial investments rose 16.7 percent to 112.37 points, registering the highest fluctuation. Also the confidence in the purchase of housing rose 2.4 percent, entering a positive land (100.22 points), after increasing 6.5 percent in the last three months of last year, following the descent of housing prices. In the negative field, the largest descent happened in the chapter of trust in the local economy, which fell 3.14 percent to the border of lack of confidence, with 100.61 points, almost repeating the drop in the last three months of 2024 (3.13 percent) and adding the third consecutive quarter in breaking. Also the confidence in relation prices fell 2.32 percent for negative terrain (98 points), after the last quarter of 2024 has risen 6.38 percent for neutrality (100.35). Confidence in living level began to occupy the second place in the podium, despite the quarterly descent from 0.2 percent to 108.3 points. Also confidence in the labor market descended 0.76 percent to 103.39 points. Must's team highlighted the fact that confidence in the local economy has been falling three in a row, which considers it to be a sign of alert to risk in the economic environment. Academics also highlight the weak growth of the global economy as an influence on the results of the inquiry, which was performed before the imposition of the global scale of commercial tariffs by Donald Trump administration.

item.title: Tourism | Almost 409 thousand visitors in three days
item.description: Between Friday and Sunday, 408,778 visitors entered Macao, according to data released by the Public Security Police Corps. The weekend prolonged by the Cheng Ming holiday (All Souls' Day) registered a number of progressively lower visitors, that is, after the more than 173,000 tourists who arrived in Macao on Friday, the number was decreasing until Sunday. As tradition dictates, the border post of the doors of the siege registered the largest flow of crossings, with 185,152 visitors in the three days, followed by the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge post, with 81,464 entries and the 62,854 Hengqin post. With the registration during the extended weekend, the number of entries in Macao since the beginning of the year has exceeded 10 million visitors.

item.title: Housing | Centaline warns that prices will fall up to 20 percent
item.description:
The real estate agency draws a negative scenario of the real estate market, which affects the price of housing, but also the rent of stores. According to the company, after years in denial, the landlords of stores begin to realize that they will lose money
The Centaline Real Estate Agency foresees that housing prices will have a broken 10 to 20 percent throughout the year. The forecast appears in the agency's latest report on the local real estate market, published at the end of last week, and points out that the sector crosses an "ice age." "The Macao real estate market is going through a 'U' form phase of development, so the pressure to reduce housing prices are expected to extend," is mentioned. "Housing prices will cross a new vacancy of breaks between 10 and 20 percent," he was added. By referring to the form of “U”, the centine predicts that the fall is followed by a period of growth after a phase of stagnation. However, it is necessary to reach the bottom. And this moment is difficult to predict: "The dimension of the fall will depend on several factors, including the pace of interest reduction in the United States, as well as market aid policies," he was explained. Based on this trend, the agency admits that a “ice age” is lived: “the real estate market has entered the ice age, with housing prices and the volume of transactions falling,” he was written. "In the second quarter, our estimates point to the volume of transactions of about 200 transactions per month," was planned. Wake up to reality Regarding the store lease market, the situation is not much different, and the Centaline indicates that store owners will have to accept the new reality, and possibly undo the stores. "Last year, many of the investors still believed that the drop in income price was due to the pandemic or increased interest rates. They believed that everything was going back to 'normality', so they preferred to pay interest [of mortgages] and keep the bet on their investments," he was explained. "Recently, they began to realize that the days of good investment in stores have come to an end, the retail sales sector has been transformed and dependence on physical stores has decreased considerably. So the value of stores is gradually decreasing. In holding their investments, they will hardly get good results," he was added. The centine thus draws a scenario at two speeds. In the most central tourism zones, it admits that there were close to 20 leases where the income value was above 100 thousand patacas. However, in community neighborhoods the situation is very different, especially at the level of stores in Nape or Horta and Costa.

item.title: USA | Beijing criticizes JD Vance's remarks about “Chinese peasants”
item.description: China called the comments of the vice president of the United States, JD Vance, who stated in an interview that Washington was asking money to borrow from the “Chinese peasants” and then buy them the fruits of their work. In an interview with Fox News, Vance defended President Donald Trump's commercial offensive, who shook the world economy by introducing customs rates, in particular against China, despite fears of global repercussions and criticism within his own party. "We borrow money from Chinese peasants to buy what Chinese peasants produce," Vance said. A spokesman for the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs said yesterday that "China's position on Sino-American economic and commercial relations was clearly expressed." "It is surprising and sad to hear such ignorant and unkind words from this vice president," Lin Jian said at a press conference. The vice president of the United States said he saw this measure as an antidote to the "globalist economy," which, in his opinion, is not working for the benefit of the American people. "This is not a method for economic prosperity. It is not a method for low prices, and is not a method for good jobs in the United States of America," added Donald Trump's right -hand man.

item.title: China with nothing to lose if rates increase another 50 percent, economists say
item.description: Beijing is approaching a point where there is nothing to be losing in the trade war with Washington, economists said after US President Donald Trump threatened to increase rates by another 50 percent over Chinese products. “The profit margin of the Chinese export sector is between 30 percent and 40 percent,” wrote Dan Wang, director for China of the reflection group ('Think Tank') Eurasia Group. "If the United States impose customs rates more than 35 percent, most of its profits will be eliminated. The fact that the rates are 70 percent or even 1000 percent makes no big difference, as it prevents China from negotiating directly with the United States," he argued. Since his inauguration in January, Trump has applied an additional 20 percent overflow on Chinese products entering the United States. This surcharge should increase to 54 percent tomorrow. In response, Beijing has announced that it will impose 34 percent rates on US products from Thursday. The president of the United States threatened on Monday to increase rates by another 50 percent if Beijing maintains his decision. In the whole, the rates would go to about 115 percent, according to Su Yue, the main economist for China at Economist Intelligence Unit. "In addition, all the conversations with China about the meetings they asked for us will be closed," Trump threatened. Wang explained that although Chinese exporters are now facing the new reality of a permanent increase in export costs, this does not mean that exports will stop. On the contrary, it forces exporters to find new markets and reduce the shipping of goods directly to the US. Alicia Garcia-Herrero, chief economist for the Asia Pacific region of the French investment bank Natixis, also minimized Trump's last threat. "The US market is already closed to Chinese products, at least directly from China to the US, so [an additional 50 percent increase in tariffs] is not a [effective] threat," he said. item.title: Visit | Spanish PM in China for the third time in two years
item.description:
In the middle of trade war, the Spanish government leader returns to China to establish bilateral agreements with the Asian giant
Spain Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez visits two of the countries most affected by the new commercial rates announced by the United States, Vietname and China to promote trade and bilateral investments. In the case of China, it is the third time in just two years that Sánchez visits Beijing and will meet again with the country's president, Xi Jinping, as happened in March 2023 and September 2024. This trip to Asia occurs a few days after US President Donald Trump has announced the intention to impose and aggravate rates on products imported across the country, with China and Vietnam to be the most percentage: 34 percent and 46 percent respectively. The Spanish government has highlighted in recent days that Sánchez's visits to Vietname and China have been coordinated with the European Union (EU) and were already planned before Trump's announcements. Sánchez's trip to Vietname and China is thus not response to the US trade war or "against anyone," the same sources said, who recognized, however, that the trip has acquired new relevance in the context of the last days. Spain's goal is to diversify markets for export, as well as destination and origin of investments, but not replace the commercial relationship with the US, the Spanish government said. Spain has with Vietname and China a huge commercial imbalance, which aims to reduce. According to official data, in 2024, Spain imported from Vietname 5.200 million euros and exported 530 million. In the case of China, imports rose to 45 billion euros and exports to 7,400 million. Diversification key Last week, the day after the announcement of the new US commercial fees, Sánchez accused Trump of starting an unjust and unjustified trade war against everything and against everyone ”and with a" unilateral attack. " The Spanish Prime Minister has appealed to an EU response to negotiate with the US and the imposition of reciprocal rates, but also for the diversification of business partners, in line with the principle of “strategic autonomy of Europe” in which European leaders have insisted in recent years, especially after the Ukraine war started by Russia. China “has to be a strategic partner in the future” and “regardless of the current situation compared to the United States,” the Spanish minister of the economy, Carlos Cuerpo, in Luxembourg, said on Monday, coming to a meeting of EU ministers with the Commerce Folder. "Among other things because it helps us open a very important market and, moreover, it is a potential source of investments in our continent, in our countries," added the minister, who said Spain wants to "establish a strategic relationship with China." Travel plan Sánchez begins tomorrow the first visit of a Spanish Prime Minister to Vietnam, which includes meetings with political leaders in the country and entrepreneurs. It arrives in China on Friday and has on the agenda meetings in Beijing, with Chinese president, Xi Jinping, Prime Minister, Li Qiang, and with Chinese businessmen. The previous visit, in September 2024, coincided with a moment of tension between the European Union and China, because of Brussels' decision to advance with new rates on the importation of Chinese electric cars and the threat of retaliation in relation to European pig meat, which Spain is one of the largest producers within the community block. In addition to trade, Spain has attracted significant Chinese investments in recent years. According to official data from Spain authorities, Chinese companies have invested more than 10 billion euros in the country for the production of electric cars, along with other projects in the area of ​​batteries or electrolyzers (used in the production of the so -called Green Hydrogen).

item.title: Japan | IWO JIMA VISIT IMPERIAL
item.description:
The visit of the Japanese emperors serves to mark the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II, in a territory that was the scene of one of the most bloody battles of the conflict
The emperors of Japan, Naruhito and Masako, yesterday arrived on the island of Iwo Jima, scenario of one of the most bloody battles of World War II, under the 80th anniversary celebrations of the end of the global conflict. This is the first time that the imperial couple has visited the remote island, now officially designated Ioto, located about 1,250 kilometers south of Tokyo, where they will pay tribute to the war memorials highlighted there. The Battle of Iwo Jima is considered one of the bloodiest battles of the Pacific World War Pacific campaign. During the five weeks that lasted, about 7,000 US soldiers and almost 22,000 Japanese soldiers were killed, among 80,000 soldiers who fought on this island of only 21 square kilometers. The island take, remote and strongly fortified, on March 26, 1945, was considered a fundamental step in advancing allied forces in the Pacific, in order to invade the main territory of the Japanese archipelago, although the strategic importance of the battle is still debated by the experts. The island was returned to Japanese sovereignty in 1968 and officially renamed Ioto in 2007, at the request of the area inhabitants, a name actually used by the former inhabitants. The island was wrongly designated by Iwo Jima when the inhabitants were removed shortly before the battle. After the occupation, the inhabitants were not allowed to return and, during the US occupation, the island maintained that name, which contributed to popularize the caption of Joe Roshental's historical photography, in which US marines are raising the US flag, an adapted image for clint Eastwood. Other visits In 1994, emperors Akihito and Michiko visited the island to pay tribute, within the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II, marked a year later. The presence of Naruhito and Masako follows a previous tribute on March 29, starring Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and the Ministers of Defense of Japan and the United States, Gen Nakatani and Pete Hegseth. The digression of the emperors this year continues in June with a stint in Okinawa, the southernmost island city hall of Japan, where another of the most emblematic battles of this war took place, the battle of Okinawa. In the coming months, the imperial couple will also visit Hiroshima and Nagasaki, on the first trip to the cities devastated by US nuclear bombing since they ascended to the throne.

item.title: China prepared to wage commercial combat with USA
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party's official newspaper (CCP) yesterday admitted that the rates imposed by Washington will impact the Chinese economy, but pointed out that the leadership in Beijing was already preparing for this moment. "Although international markets generally consider that US tariff abuse exceeded expectations, the [Communist] Central Committee had already foreseen this new round of economic and commercial containment and repression against China, fully estimated its potential impact and prepared response plans with sufficient time and reserves," the People's Diary said. Recognizing that the application of additional customs of 34 percent on imports from China, in addition to the 20 percent rates previously imposed, will result in a “reducing bilateral trade with the US” and a “short -term negative impact on exports”, the newspaper recalled that “many US products have high dependence on China”. "The US depend on China not only for many consumer goods, but also for investment and intermediate products, with a dependence of over 50 percent in various categories, which makes it difficult to find alternatives in the international international market," reads in the editorial. The percentage of exports from China to the United States, compared to total external sales, fell from 19.2 percent in 2018 to 14.7 percent in 2024. Part of this fall is due to 'triangular trade', in which products are exported almost completed from China to other countries, including Vietnam, Thailand or Cambodia, where a component or finish is added, In order to change the manufacture place, aiming to circumvent the rates. The People's Diary has recalled that in recent years, “despite internal and external pressures,” Beijing “has been persisted in doing difficult but correct things,” including release the real estate sector and reducing the indebtedness of local and small and medium financial institutions. "These three major risks have been effectively controlled and contained and are decreasing," he said. Big Pointing out the “large dimension” of the Chinese economy, the newspaper recalled that China has monetary policy instruments, such as reducing mandatory reserve ratio and interest rates, to stimulate domestic consumption with “extraordinary strength”, which would allow the Asian to reduce its dependence on exports. "The domestic market has a wide margin of maneuver," said the Chinese Communist Party's official newspaper. He also stressed the country's ability to transform the adverse effect of US measurements into an "impulse" to accelerate economic transformation and "industrial innovation." "Strangular, repressing and restricting only forces China to accelerate fundamental technological advances in key areas," he said.

item.title: Commerce | USA accused of unilateralism, protectionism and intimidation
item.description:
The trade war imposed on the world by Donald Trump intensifies. Beijing responds with new rates and suspends imports from various US products, while ensuring that “the sky will not fall”
China yesterday accused the United States of unilateralism, protectionism and economic intimidation, in view of the intensifying of the trade war between Beijing and Washington. "Putting 'America first', above international rules, is a typical act of unilateralism, protectionism and economic bullying," the spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Lin Jian told a press conference. Last week, Trump imposed an additional 34 percent rate on products from China, as part of the “Liberation Day”, which added to two 10 percent rounds already declared in February and March. China quickly retaliated with its own 34 percent rate on American products. Beijing also suspended imports of sorghum, capoeira birds and bone flour from some US companies. China's latest retaliation measures include more export controls on rare land minerals, essential for various technologies, and a judicial action in the World Trade Organization. Lin stated that Trump's rates impair the stability of global production and supply chains and seriously affect world economic recovery. "Pressure and threats are not the best way to deal with China," said Lin. "China will firmly safeguard its legitimate rights and interests," he added. Confidence votes Beijing transmitted confidence yesterday, with the People's Diary, the official newspaper of the Communist Party, to ensure that "the sky will not fall." "Given the indiscriminate blows of US rates, we know what we are doing and we have instruments at our disposal," he added. It is not known if China's leader Xi Jinping will meet Trump to reach an agreement. Lin addressed questions about a possible meeting to other departments. On Sunday, Chinese government officials met with representatives from US companies, including Tesla and GE Healthcare. "The root of the problem of customs rates is in the US," said Ling Ji, Deputy Minister of Commerce, at the meeting with 20 US companies, according to a statement. "We hope that US companies can solve the problem by the root, issue reasonable statements, make concrete measures and work together to safeguard the stability of global supply chains," he said. Ling, who is also China's adjunct commercial negotiator, has ensured that the Asian country will protect “legitimate rights and interests of foreign -funded companies according to the law” and “actively promote the resolution of their problems and demands”. Guaranteed protection The Chinese Deputy Minister of Commerce, Ling Ji, said yesterday to representatives of US companies such as Tesla and GE Healthcare that Beijing will “always protect” the rights of companies with foreign capital, compared to the trade war triggered by Washington. "China has been, is and will be an ideal, safe and promising investment destination for foreign investors," Ling said during a round table with more than 20 US capital companies in Beijing, according to a statement widespread by the Chinese Ministry of Commerce.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”

The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution
What are the challenges felt by teachers with the introduction of technologies in the classroom? Can the mobile phone actually be a complement to learning? Yes. I've been saying this since 2005. The mobile phone can be an excellent learning tool, a means to motivate students and to enrich their learning. We have a kind of Swiss knife here, a very powerful equipment in the hands of the students and there is a school failure, because they do not work and help students enhance this equipment they have. What happens is that students learn in the worst way, in a destructed way, by attempt-rrove. There is a gap, as students are not alerted to the positive potential for mobile phone use. During the pandemic period, for example, the use of technologies, with distance learning, was quite enhanced. With the pandemic the use of these equipment proved that without them the situation of education would have been much worse. In these pandemic years, teachers have become more aware of the technologies that already exist and are available to anyone. With internet access on mobile phone, something that has existed since 2007 with the launch of the first iPhone, the e-learning system is enhanced and then we move to “Mobile Learning”, where you can learn anywhere and anytime with mobile devices. It is this reality that we see a little away from school. And after the pandemic, how has it been? I think we will take a few more steps towards digital literacy. With Artificial Intelligence (IA), it seems that we are as in the phase I created my first website in 1999 or email in 1995. We are at the beginning. We teachers, when we do digital training, are doing good to society because we are also preparing these young people for the future, because they will be parents and should be aware of educating their children. At school we do not only prepare for the job market, but for personal and family life. Hence teacher education is essential. I tell my students that they should be ashamed, because they have much easier access to content than in my time, when we truly had to do research and read in physical format. One of the works we have with students is to teach them how to make bibliographic references, refer to the sources. But I am an optimistic by nature, and I hope that in a decade, secondary education students who are fathers and mothers will be able to deal with these problems of social networks and increase fraud with their children.
